thread.title: Fort Collins football needs a win to get back on track
thread.title_full: Fort Collins football needs a win to get back on track

title: Fort Collins football needs a win to get back on track
text:
Fort Collins football needs a win to get back on track Fort Collins hosts Loveland in final nonconference game of the season. Post to Facebook Fort Collins football needs a win to get back on track Fort Collins hosts Loveland in final nonconference game of the season. Check out this story on coloradoan.com: http://noconow.co/1FEkAhC Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Kevin Lytle, kevinlytle@coloradoan.com 9:09 a.m. MDT September 30, 2015 Fort Collins High School quarterback Cory Lange makes a hand off to Luke Weaver during a game against Windsor earlier this season. The Lambkins host Loveland at 6 p.m. Thursday at French Field. (Photo: Austin Humphreys/The Coloradoan) 
Time to get back on track. 
The Fort Collins High School football team is off to a disappointing 1-3 start to the season. 
Key injuries have set back the Lambkins, and the offense has sputtered. Coming to town for a nonconference game Thursday is an inconsistent Loveland (2-2) team. 
Here are keys to Thursday’s 6 p.m. game at French Field. 
To win, Loveland must: Unleash senior quarterback Ayden Eberhardt . It’s not complicated, but having your best player play great is a good way to win. Eberhardt completes 60 percent of his passes for 135 yards a game. He also runs for 112 per game. 
He also has a great complement in Charles Dunkelman , who runs for 85 yards a game and leads the Indians in tackles. If those two have big games, it will lead Loveland to a road win. 
To win, Fort Collins must: Just find a way. The Lambkins’ path to the playoffs is to win the Northern Conference, with league play starting next week. But a nonconference win Thursday is necessary for the Lambkins. In the big picture, though, Fort Collins likely won’t be able to earn an at-large berth into the 16-team Class 4A playoff field. 
They need to get back on track and gain the confidence a win brings. So run the offense through Kielar Harpham in the wildcat. Sling it around with Cory Lange . Run 30 times with Sam Bostak and Luke Weaver . Run exotic defenses at Loveland. Whatever the method is, just find a way back into the win column. 
Follow sports reporter Kevin Lytle at twitter.com/Kevin_Lytle and at facebook.com/KevinSLytle. 
Week 5 local football schedule 
Thursday: Loveland at Fort Collins, 6 p.m. at French Field. Twitter updates: @Kevin_Lytle . Watch: Coloradoan.com/sports 
Thursday: Rocky Mountain at Horizon, 7 p.m. at North Stadium. Twitter updates: @ColoradoanSpts 
Friday: Fossil Ridge at Poudre, 7 p.m. at French Field. Twitter updates: @Kevin_Lytle . Watch: Coloradoan.com/sports 
Friday: Skyline at Windsor, 7 p.m. Twitter updates: @QSickafoose 
Friday: Resurrection Christian at Lyons, 7 p.m. Twitter updates: @ColoradoanSpts Read or Share this story: http://noconow.co/1FEkAhC TOP VIDEOS
